ai.summary: Gunwalloe BR 10 is a short, easy 3.8 km coastal hike in the UK. The route is suitable for beginners and families seeking a straightforward, scenic walk with mild elevation and mostly even footing.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat coastal footpath with packed earth and gravel. Occasional grassy verges and short steps. Some sections near the shoreline may be uneven, and weather can affect footing. Tidal and sea spray risks exist on exposed stretches.
ai.safety_notes: - Check tide times and possible closures before you go; coastal sections can be affected by waves and erosion. - Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear with good grip. - Dress in layers and bring a lightweight waterproof jacket; coastal weather can change quickly. - Bring water, snacks, and a map or offline GPS; keep your phone charged. - Stay on marked paths, supervise children and pets, and be cautious on slippery rocks near the shore. - Inform someone of your plan and expected return time.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for best weather and daylight; can be done year-round with extra caution in winter due to wetter conditions.

seo.title: Gunwalloe BR 10 – Easy 3.8 km Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Gunwalloe BR 10 coastal trail, a short and easy 3.8 km hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and packing lists.
